repnme.cdata!:
Cyprus - Southeast Coast Sewerage and
            Drainage Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Southeast Coast Sewerage and
            Drainage Project's outcome was fully satisfactory for
            the Larnaca component and marginally satisfactory for the
            Paralimni-Ayia Napa components. The key lessons learned
            include: a) The Paralimni Sewerage Board and the Ayia Napa
            Sewerage Board faced difficulties in handling promptly the
            issues that needed the joint decision of the two boards.
            During the project preparation, the joint venture approach
            should have been subject to a more thorough review taking
            into account not only the economic and financial
            implications, but also the legal, social, and political
            aspects and engineering issues. b) The turnkey bidding
            approach is sometimes favored by the employer because they
            do not need to carry out the detailed design before issuing
            the invitation bid. However the total amount of time
            required for completing the whole bidding process should be
            considered. Also, a technical alternative should have been
            considered only for the lowest evaluated bidder of the base
            bid. c) The appraisal projections for sewer rate structure
            and the revenues proved to be overly optimistic. d) The
            assessment of willingness-to-pay during appraisal was not
            adequate. e) The scope of the project should haven been
            defined in a more participatory manner to gain support from
            the local authorities and central government, as well as
            from the general public.

repnme.cdata!:
Cyprus - Southeast Coast Sewerage and
            Drainage Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will provide sewerage and
            drainage systems for Larnaca, and sewerage systems for the
            communities of Ayia Napa and Paralimni.  Only the first
            phase (coastal areas) of a sewerage system for Larnaca will
            be included. The project will consist of: (i) central sewage
            collection, treatment, and disposal systems; (ii) the
            distribution of treated effluent for re-use; (iii) upgrading
            the existing stormwater drainage system in Larnaca; and (iv)
            technical assistance and training and provision of related
            equipment to the sewerage boards.
